Class Maze

  • java.lang.Object
    • Maze

  • public class Maze
extends java.lang.Object
    The Maze class is responsible for creating the maze as well as changing it based on inputs from the MazeGuy class
    Author:
    Kyle Dorcey

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int columns
      number of columns, every other column is a white space in order to make the maze easier to read
      private java.lang.String[][] drawnMaze
      2D array of strings containing the maze
      private int entranceXLocation
      x location of the entrance
      private int entranceYLocation
      y location of the entrance
      private int exitXLocation
      x location of the maze's exit
      private int exitYLocation
      y location of the maze's exit
      private boolean mazeComplete
      returns true when maze is complete
      private static int rows
      number of rows
      private java.lang.String[][] xMarkers
      2d array of strings that keeps track of where X's are placed

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Maze()
      Constructor for the Maze class, calls the static method createMaze() and defineXMarkers() which defines and creates the maze and xMarkers arrays.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void breadCrumbs(int xCoord, int yCoord, java.lang.String breadCrumb)
      Marks a trail of "bread crumbs" ("x"s) to represent the path that the MazeGuy has taken through the maze if a cell is marked more than once it will switch to an "O", and if an "O" is marked again back to an "x".
      boolean checkMazeComplete(int nextXCoord, int nextYCoord)
      Checks if the maze has been completed
      static java.lang.String[][] createMaze()
      Static method which defines and creates the maze that will be solved.
      static java.lang.String[][] defineXMarkers()
      static method which defines the xMarkers 2D array when called by the constructor
      int getColumns()
      returns the amount of columns in the maze
      int getEntranceYLocation()
      returns the y-location of the maze's exit
      int getExitXLocation()
      returns the x-location of the maze's exit
      int getInitialX()
      Returns x-location of the maze's entrance
      int getInitialY()
      returns y-location of the maze's entrance
      java.lang.String[][] getMazeMap()
      returns the 2D String array containing the maze
      int getRows()
      returns the amount of rows in the maze
      void printFinalMaze()
      prints the maze to the console with only the correct path
      void printMaze()
      Prints the maze to the console each turn
      boolean retraceExitCheck(int currentXLocation, int currentYLocation)
      When the MazeGuy's method retraceSteps() is being called, it uses this method to determine whether it should continue to follow only "x" (breadCrumb) marked spots or not.
      void updateManLocation(int xCoord, int yCoord, java.lang.String currentLocationMarker)
      Called by the MazeGuy class, updates the mazeGuy's position in the maze
      boolean validMoveCheck(int xDirectionToCheck, int yDirectionToCheck)
      Verifies that the move MazeGuy is trying to make is within the bounds of the maze, and not into a maze border

    • Constructor Detail

      • Maze

        public Maze()
        Constructor for the Maze class, calls the static method createMaze() and defineXMarkers() which defines and creates the maze and xMarkers arrays. It also sets the mazeComplete boolean to false.

        Returns x-location of the maze's entrance

        returns y-location of the maze's entrance

      • updateManLocation

        public void updateManLocation(int xCoord,
                              int yCoord,
                              java.lang.String currentLocationMarker)
        Called by the MazeGuy class, updates the mazeGuy's position in the maze
        Parameters:
        xCoord - current x-position in the maze
        yCoord - current y-position in the maze
        currentLocationMarker - marker used to represent the current position in the maze

      • checkMazeComplete

        public boolean checkMazeComplete(int nextXCoord,
                                 int nextYCoord)
        Checks if the maze has been completed
        Parameters:
        nextXCoord - the next x-position that the mazeGuy will move to
        nextYCoord - the next y-position that the MazeGuy will move to
        Returns:
        returns true if next move will result in the maze being complete

      • breadCrumbs

        public void breadCrumbs(int xCoord,
                        int yCoord,
                        java.lang.String breadCrumb)
        Marks a trail of "bread crumbs" ("x"s) to represent the path that the MazeGuy has taken through the maze if a cell is marked more than once it will switch to an "O", and if an "O" is marked again back to an "x".
        Parameters:
        xCoord - x-position to mark
        yCoord - y-position to mark
        breadCrumb - String representation of what the breadCrumbs look like

      • validMoveCheck

        public boolean validMoveCheck(int xDirectionToCheck,
                              int yDirectionToCheck)
        Verifies that the move MazeGuy is trying to make is within the bounds of the maze, and not into a maze border
        Parameters:
        xDirectionToCheck - x-position to check
        yDirectionToCheck - y-position to check
        Returns:
        validMove true if move is valid, otherwise returns false.

      • retraceExitCheck

        public boolean retraceExitCheck(int currentXLocation,
                                int currentYLocation)
        When the MazeGuy's method retraceSteps() is being called, it uses this method to determine whether it should continue to follow only "x" (breadCrumb) marked spots or not. When this method returns true, that method will exit.
        Parameters:
        currentXLocation - current x-location
        currentYLocation - current y-location
        Returns:
        boolean exitCheck. Returns true if there is a spot immediately next to the current x-y location that is a "."

      • printMaze

        public void printMaze()
        Prints the maze to the console each turn

      • printFinalMaze

        public void printFinalMaze()
        prints the maze to the console with only the correct path

      • defineXMarkers

        public static java.lang.String[][] defineXMarkers()
        static method which defines the xMarkers 2D array when called by the constructor
        Returns:
        xMarkers[][]

      • createMaze

        public static java.lang.String[][] createMaze()
        Static method which defines and creates the maze that will be solved.
        Returns:
        createdMaze[][]
